intro: Acourtia potosina, commonly known as the Potosí dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Acourtia potosina is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
